data.text: @TheTalkCBS I think this is a ridiculous subject children see a lot worse and hear a lot more than worrying about having Cosmopolitan magazine around for them to see it do you really think they would read it there to into their electronics#myopinion
@TheTalkCBS No it shouldn’t because children knows more than what grownups think. Remember the word “social media”...wait 4 it, exactly. Oh yeah, if your child doesn’t have sm, their friends do

@TheTalkCBS Now we are censoring Cosmopolitan Magazine.  Then you should take down most magazines that either have have violent content, fitness mags that show how we should look etc. What is next, banning books again#EverybodyTalks
@TheTalkCBS A grocery chain here has plastic inserts to cover suggestive magazines at checkouts . You can see magazine titles just not the covers. They've been doing it for years.

@TheTalkCBS Personally I have never seen kids reading the mags in a check out line, they are usually  interested in candy + gum. I also haven't noticed a Cosmo at the check out stand, usually just People, US, +  the usual trash mags, that only the women tend to read + an occasional male.

@TheTalkCBS Not to mention the famous “people of Walmart”. Have you seen some of those outfits? Nothing to the imagination. Is the store going to ban under dressed patrons? Also better hide the undergarments racks with all the bras. It’s too suggestive. (Sarcasm)

@TheTalkCBS Here is my solution for the magazines that want to remain in that prime impulse buying location. Put a simple seal strip from front cover to the back cover.  You or your kids break the seal you buy it.

@TheTalkCBS Kids of all ages are exposed to way worse content with their smartphones and tablets. Also what about the video game display and bins full of DVDs? Those have racy covers along with books and don’t forget the men’s underwear packages! Don’t be naive!
@TheTalkCBS If "we" have to clean up in the check out lanes...can we get a "clean up" in the white house too?  Explaining to kids what a "porn star" is is much worse than anything on mag covers!
@TheTalkCBS But they keep the horrific energy drinks and loads of junk food at the check out lines. 🙄

@HarleyLover2017 @TheTalkCBS We'll just have to agree to disagree.  As a parent, we need to protect and prepare them for the harshness of the world.  And you know you aren't done.....I see you on everyone's tweets.  LOL!  You have a wonderful day or evening.
@TheTalkCBS For family values?They sell firearms,bow and arrows,ammunition  just isles away from children's toys....but somehow a scantily clad good looking man is offensive?
@_SupaKat_ @TheTalkCBS Kids are also a product of their surroundings & society. We've gotta start somewhere. Now I'm done.
@TheTalkCBS GET OVER IT. IT'S JUST THE  CHECK OUT GO TO THE MAGAZINE SECTION OF THE STORE

@HarleyLover2017 @TheTalkCBS No matter how we try to shelter our kids, we can't follow them around.  We have to prepare them for the world.  It's not just about mags.   Society can't parent...we have to.  Now I'm done.

@HarleyLover2017 @TheTalkCBS Both of my kids were bullied.  BAD!  As well as I.  Kids are a product of their parents. Every situation is different, yes.  But pulling this mag for all of those reasons?  It's a larger conversation.  Not just about pulling the mag.

@HarleyLover2017 @TheTalkCBS Because why should it matter?? Is cosmo really any worse than the other magazines they have near the checkout aisle? People? The inquirer? There are a lot worse things than a Cosmo magazine that probably half of us don’t even read

@VRTroopers13 @TheTalkCBS Some may go down the mag aisle but EVERY kid is gonna go through the checkout aisles. It doesn't matter to YOU where they put it so why are you continuing this discussion? It does matter to ME.

@HarleyLover2017 @TheTalkCBS I’m really just wondering what the big deal is, they’re probably gonna ask whether it’s in the checkout aisle or in the magazine section so to me it doesn’t really matter where you put it. Someone’s gonna go down there and some kids gonna ask what it means
@TheTalkCBS    In today's world children are seeing to much of everything. I just cannot figure out how society have allowed this to happen.

@_SupaKat_ @TheTalkCBS That's great but not all kids are the same are they? Or do you not want to concede that fact either? Some are teased about their looks, some are being pressured to have sex at an early age & others are being molested but let's not take them into account either. I'm done.

@VRTroopers13 @TheTalkCBS You're giving me a headache, what is the problem with moving them from the aisles & just having them in the magazine area? There is none, you just want to argue & I'm done with it. It's gonna happen & I'm glad, you cab always protest it if it means that much to you.
@_SupaKat_ @TheTalkCBS It goes on & on. https://t.co/zvchgdaQft
@_SupaKat_ @TheTalkCBS  https://t.co/cHz3ZoCt0L
@_SupaKat_ @TheTalkCBS  https://t.co/d611eqJKv4
@_SupaKat_ @TheTalkCBS  https://t.co/poVBcJWVpM

@_SupaKat_ @TheTalkCBS I don't think "taking Cosmo off the shelf will do the job" but I think moving them isn't going to affect any1 at all, except Cosmo. No1's asking for them to be taken off the shelf. Naughty orgasm tricks? We all need 2 c that don't we? 7 y.o. kids read & want 2 b her! Body shaming https://t.co/iUbiIMrwOZ

@HarleyLover2017 @TheTalkCBS Half of those women are appropriately covered up as far as I can tell. Look if you want to look at them don’t pay attention to them and just ignore them. Distract the kids with trading cards or whatever else is in the checkout line, don’t have to resort to moving a magazine

@VRTroopers13 @TheTalkCBS It's about putting them n an appropriate place, that's all. Y some1 else is worried about when or how I decide 2 tell my kids about sex is beyond me. We all have different morals & expectations for our children. Sex & scantily clad women on most of their covers, just move them. https://t.co/bE1qkRmgRk
@HarleyLover2017 @TheTalkCBS But why try and hide it away from the child? I never paid attention to Cosmo when I was in the grocery store as a kid and I didn’t read one til college

@HarleyLover2017 @TheTalkCBS My 22 year old daughter is still a virgin and isn't interested.  All my 14 year old wants to do is learn how to create video games. We talked to them honestly and answer any of their questions.  Any and all of them.

@HarleyLover2017 @TheTalkCBS I homeschooled my kids.  Still am.  I did that for many reason. What are you saying?Society can't hurt much with good parenting.  If you think taking Cosmo off the shelf is going to do the job, it's not.
@TheTalkCBS I say leave the shit on the damn shelf & walk your kids right by it.
@TheTalkCBS No
@TheTalkCBS Having certain magazine's at the checkout line never hurt any child of mine. You just tell them it's not kid friendly. Some parents give their kids to much free range!

@TheTalkCBS Yes, should have been done a long time ago. Disturbing to see when checking out with your children and they have to see all that at the front. We need to get back to standard and values, we have reduced ourselves to a new low. Leave them in the magazine isles where they belong.

@TheTalkCBS Personally, I think it is fine to leave the magazine. When you hide things from children, they develop curiosity. If there are questions, it is a way to have a healthy dialogue between parent and child. Builds the relationship.
@TheTalkCBS NO !
@TheTalkCBS Star and Enquirer are not G Rated. Is it better to show rumor mill (often untrue) drama magazines about celebrity’s personal lives? This ridiculous.

@TheTalkCBS Yes, my son when he was 2 1/2 years old saw The Cosmopolitan  Magazine cover. While we're in line he spelled,  "S-E-X" , then he asked,  Mommy  what  does that word mean."  It was one of those long Walmart lines and everyone turned and looked at me

@_SupaKat_ @TheTalkCBS No exceptions to society's rules? None at all? What about homeschooled kids & parents? What about people who are raising their children to not be sexual at an early age or to wait until they are married?
@TheTalkCBS maybe just not accessible..top shelf.. my kids are more into the gum and candy thing..that keeps their attention that isn't so healthy either ..
@TheTalkCBS Yes I do
@NOAFitnessNY @TheTalkCBS We don'have guns in Indy stores
@TheTalkCBS Our stores have a piece of plastic in front of those magazines so only the title shows.
@TheTalkCBS Children  don't need to see cosmopolitan the magazine is just removed from the clout there is a magazine section I another part of the store

@TheTalkCBS Just an example of Cosmo's covers, every 1 has something about sex & scantily dressed women on almost every 1 of them but u don't want young girls to compare themselves 2 airbrushed models. You really think this is appropriate for every child to see & read? Really? https://t.co/yvyrqY9QKJ
@TheTalkCBS 😡 Then remove all the other clutter with it then

@TheTalkCBS Gezzz when a child doing homework and may begin typing. Pumpkin..but Pu. y pop up.with pictures & all! !you might need cosmopolitan to help explain. This day & time kids know more then we think. Working at daycare i had a 5 year old tell me he was gay & with who & things they did
@TheTalkCBS Keep the magazines

@HarleyLover2017 @TheTalkCBS I turned them around when need be.  Elementary schools are out of control these days.  I promise you, they have heard and spoke about sex.  My mom talked to me at an early age.  I did the same.  Most are looking and begging for candy.
@PurplePrince18 @TheTalkCBS I agree l don't waste my money and most magazine's are all gossip and l'd rather read a really good non fiction book from my local library. When l am not on my laptop👩🏻‍💻
@JeanneK29286258 @TheTalkCBS Let's put milk & bread in those impulse spots for those of us that forget & have to run all the way to the back of the store to get the milk they've forgotten.
@2Sketchable @TheTalkCBS It's not about buying it as much as it is about seeing & reading it I don't think.

@GAdevilgrl @TheTalkCBS I'm glad they are, some of these mags have women half dressed on their covers but don't want women to be subjected to men leering at them because of what they wear or girls to feel they're less then the air brushed models on these magazines. I'm so confused.
@MrsJLRussell @TheTalkCBS Why is the timing up to any store or magazine to have that discussion?
@ERCsWILL @TheTalkCBS @Cosmopolitan Lol, you're effing joking right?

@_SupaKat_ @TheTalkCBS What about the kids younger than 14? They start reading words long before 14 & is it really up to Cosmo or any person or store to determine when that discussion needs to be held?
@TheTalkCBS No. First time they get in the store they 🏃‍♀️ to the toy section when is checkout time it’s Candy time. 💯✌🏾😁
@JigsawFirefly @TheTalkCBS And I'd have to ask why they haven't.

@VRTroopers13 @TheTalkCBS Not necessarily true & if the conversation comes up shouldn't it be at the time that's more appropriate for that parent & their child? Not everything has to be discussed in an open forum.

@CharGlenna @TheTalkCBS What about younger kids? You're assuming all young teen girls have done, seen or talked about ?able content but that's not the case I don't think. Perhaps the majority have seen it but that's because of magazines & Hollywood & music making it commonplace in our society.
@TheTalkCBS No they should not be removed this is getting ridiculous

@TheTalkCBS Good! If u want it go 2 the mag aisle 2 get it, GQ & others that have ?able content/pics on the front. Some things don't have to be commonplace in our society, 4 the kids if 4 no other reason. We want to protect the children right? Sensitive pics & content fall n2 that realm 2.
@TheTalkCBS How else are kids sposed to learn what matches their natural skin tone or get they're horoscope. Keep @Cosmopolitan in the checkout.

@TheTalkCBS I don’t think Cosmo is the magazine to worry about. It’s not that bad. The worst it’s going to do is start a conversation about subjects that some may be uncomfortable with... but those conversations have to happen anyways, so why not organically in the moment?

@TheTalkCBS Walmart did this originally a couple of years ago. I worked there as CSM, constantly had to remind the vendor to keep Cosmo off the front end (the book/mag. dept was okay.) OR use a specific "sleeve" to cover it. Apparently they just stopped enforcing it are now pushing it again.
@TheTalkCBS Does anyone remember Teen Vogue's tutorial about anal sex? Who wants to explain to a 9 year old who can read or even a 14 year old what anal sex is? I applaud Walmart!
@TheTalkCBS My little ones can't spell yet.🙂
@TheTalkCBS No they dont need to be G rated for children. There's a 99cent store here that has condoms and pregnancy tests at the check out and no one has complained.
@TheTalkCBS First of all it's not Hustler... And the kids look at the candy at checkout not books 🙄🙄 ijs😘😘 love you all
@TheTalkCBS Sheryl, in all honesty, I don't think there shall be a G-Rated line 4 kids. I don't think some really care 4 those Cosmopolitan magazines anyway. My opinion. #EverybodyTalks

@TheTalkCBS Cosmo is considered inappropriate , but not selling guns??? Nothing wrong with nudity/sex amongst consenting adults. The fact that Walmart is more comfortable with violence than sexuality is archaic.

@TheTalkCBS Yes think it's a good idea. Plenty of other space for adult content. Though how about all that candy it's a parents nightmare when checking out. Kids having meltdowns on not getting the candy they see. ha
@TheTalkCBS I don’t mind it. Just ignore. Love your top❤️

@TheTalkCBS I'm with sarah! Teenage girls have either dine it, seen it or talk about it by then anyway. Just cuz you're uncomfortable as a parent doesn't mean it doesn't need to be talked about or can't be seen
@TheTalkCBS My answer is NO! It should not be "G" rated. It's enough candy bars, sodas, & chips on every isle to become "G" rated. Ain't that the truth?! Yaw been to Wal-Mart!👍👍
@TheTalkCBS Bull shit, shame on them

@TheTalkCBS Most stores have a line where their were no candy or mags.  What happened to that? And 14 year olds are talking about worse in school and see it on the internet.  They should have already had the talk by then. IMO
@TheTalkCBS No! Sex is life,you can't hide your kids from it when it's EVERYWHERE! Stop hiding things from your kids before someone else explain it wrong to your kids!!!

@TheTalkCBS Personally I don’t really care, it’s like Sheryl said it’s an impulse buy. What if the same subject matter was on another magazine, the whole cycle starts again. You’re gonna have the conversation whether it’s on the magazine or not
@TheTalkCBS As a former magazine merchandiser, I know that Wal-Mart has magazine racks well above eye level of young children.  Revamp the planogram. Simple.
@TheTalkCBS Glad they are removing it! And I don’t see any male magazine with those titles In Walmart check so it’s not a women vs man thing. Smart move @Walmart ! 👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼
@TheTalkCBS No i dont kids are looking at candy and other things not magazines

@TheTalkCBS @TheTalkCBS magazines in the checkout line don't matter. If the kids are young, you tell them to put them back. If the kids are teenagers, keep them distracted. My teenager never even paid attention to them!

@TheTalkCBS If people are so concerned about what children see in check out lines. And doing what’s right by the kids then remove the chips, candy, and soda for that matter. People wanna complain about cosmo but will let the kids eat processed trash?
